meanings.definition: To make fancier or more elaborate.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to fancify her room by adding colorful pillows.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to fancify the dish by adding edible flowers as garnish.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fancify his outfit by wearing a bow tie with polka dots.
meanings.sent4: The artist fancified the painting with intricate swirls and patterns.
meanings.sent5: The garden was fancified with fairy lights and sparkling decorations.

meanings.definition: To add decorative or ornamental elements.
meanings.sent1: The cake was fancified with sugar flowers and frosting designs.
meanings.sent2: She fancified her hair with a glittery hair clip.
meanings.sent3: The cat fancified its collar with a tiny bell that jingled as it walked.
meanings.sent4: The room was fancified with elegant curtains and golden tassels.
meanings.sent5: The gift was fancified with a shiny bow and a personalized tag.

meanings.definition: To enhance the appearance or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding fresh flowers can fancify any room instantly.
meanings.sent2: She fancified her presentation with colorful slides and engaging visuals.
meanings.sent3: He fancified his sandwich by cutting it into fun shapes with cookie cutters.
meanings.sent4: The music producer fancified the song with catchy beats and harmonies.
meanings.sent5: The garden was fancified with a beautiful fountain and fragrant flowers.
